result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven K. Lehman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence the defendant is currently serving.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence the defendant is currently serving.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Comply with all other conditions of extended supervision or any other probation that the defendant has.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven K. Lehman

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed.

Atty Cousins states plea agreement.
Atty Nielsen concurs.

Atty Nielsen has received a copy of the information and waives reading of the information.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 1

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
Defendant acknowledges previous conviction

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: 941.29(2)  939.62(1)(c)
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Nielsen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court agrees with the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 5 Years consecutive to any sentence Defendant is currently serving
2 Years 6 Months Initial Confinement
2 Years 6 Months Extended Supervision
Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period fo 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
No contact with Earl Loman
Comply with all other conditions of extended supervision or any other probation that Defendant has
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons

Written explanation of determinate sentence is addressed.

9:28 AM Court is in recess.

Defendant Steven K. Lehman in court with attorney Troy L. Nielsen. Defendant Steven K. Lehman in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:06 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

This is scheduled for a prelim/arraignment/plea sentence.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, matter is resolved.  

Atty Nielsen provides the Court a written waiver of preliminary hearing.  
Court questions Defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 

Court finds Defendant freely, voluntary and intelligently waives preliminary hearing.
Court finds probable cause, bind over.

Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 07-30-2015 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-30-2015 09:00 am.

Defendant Steven K. Lehman appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan Drengler in court appearing specially for today's hearing. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

State recommends a signature bond with conditions as stated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
